original_text:
Medusa
È inutile negarlo: la storia antica, con i suoi miti e leggende, occuperanno sempre un posto di rilievo nel nostro immaginario e nelle nostre opere. Parliamo di film, libri, videogiochi e chi più ne ha più ne metta: sono sempre più i titoli che sfruttano le antiche popolazioni egizie, romane e greche come tematiche.
E il mondo delle slot online non è da meno, possiamo contare centinaia di slot ispirate all’antico Egitto e Grecia (l’impero Romano è ancora poco sfruttato a confronto) e il titolo di oggi è proprio ispirato a una delle tantissime leggende greche: il mito di Medusa.
La NextGen Gaming ci porta indietro nel tempo e a spasso nella fantasia, alla scoperta di una delle donne più famose di tutti i tempi: con i serpenti al posto dei capelli e il potere di pietrificare con lo sguardo, Medusa è conosciuta in tutto il mondo.
Scopriamola di nuovo con questa slot.

Il comparto visivo di Medusa
Cominciamo la nostra analisi dall’aspetto più diretto che ci va a colpire: la grafica. Molte case di sviluppo decidono di concentrare le proprie energie esclusivamente sulle meccaniche di gioco, consce dell’importanza che questo fattore ricopre.
Ma non smetteremo mai di dire che anche l’occhio vuole la sua parte e che una slot con del gusto estetico è più facile che venga provata da nuovi giocatori.
Medusa rientra sicuramente in questa categoria: la cornice della griglia di gioco accenna appena al mondo ellenico, con templi ed elmi che fanno da sfondo. La griglia di gioco gira sopra a quella che sembra essere pietra (forse un accenno al potere letale di Medusa) e i vari simboli sono illustrati con gusto e raffinatezza.
La nostra giocata è accompagnata dal suono dei tamburi che ci fa sentire come se fossimo in guerra, insomma: Medusa della NextGen Gaming dimostra di essere una slot piacevole da guardare prima ancora di provare il gioco vero e proprio. Vediamo se le meccaniche di gameplay sono allo stesso livello.

Come si gioca a Medusa
Quella che ci troviamo di fronte è una slot tradizionale, con cinque rulli che ruotano su loro stessi e che mostrano ognuno tre simboli per giocata. Le linee di vincita sono venticinque, un valore che rientra nella media delle slot online e l’RTP supera di poco il 95%.
L’aspetto che colpisce maggiormente di questo titolo è la presenza di numerosi simboli speciali. Si parte ovviamente con la stessa Medusa: il volto incantevole della donna è un simbolo Wild in grado di sostituire tutti gli altri simboli normali in gioco. Esso appare solamente nei tre rulli centrali.
Il titolo della slot, MEDUSA, e il cavallo alato Pegaso sono due simboli Scatter che permettono di accedere alle modalità bonus e il Soldato permette di accedere alla funzione di “Super Spin”.
Una slot quindi tutta da provare, che dimostra tanta cura nei dettagli grafici quanto nelle meccaniche di gioco.

Slot simili a Medusa
Come abbiamo stabilito all’inizio di questa recensione, il Pantheon delle slot a tema “Antica Grecia” è nutritissimo, per questo non è possibile elencarne tutte. Ma se volessimo qualche titolo affine, possiamo pensare a 300 Shields (e le varianti) sempre della NextGen Gaming, così come Age of Gods della Playtech. O ancora Aura of Zeus della Bally Wulff, casa che propone anche Disc of Athena.

raw_translation.response:
Medusa
There's no denying it: ancient history, with its myths and legends, will always have a prominent place in our imagination and in our works. We're talking about movies, books, video games, and more: there are more and more titles that exploit the ancient Egyptian, Roman, and Greek populations as themes.
And the world of online slots is no different, we can count hundreds of slots inspired by ancient Egypt and Greece (the Roman Empire is still relatively untapped in comparison) and today's title is precisely inspired by one of the many Greek legends: the myth of Medusa.
NextGen Gaming takes us back in time and on a fantasy trip, to discover one of the most famous women of all time: with snakes in place of her hair and the power to petrify with her gaze, Medusa is known all over the world.
Let's discover her again with this slot.

The visual aspect of Medusa
Let's start our analysis with the most direct aspect that will strike us: the graphics. Many development studios decide to concentrate their energies exclusively on the game mechanics, knowing the importance that this factor represents.
But we will never stop saying that the eye also wants its part and that a slot with aesthetic taste is easier to be tried by new players.
Medusa certainly falls into this category: the frame of the game grid only hints at the Hellenic world, with temples and helmets in the background. The game grid rotates above what appears to be stone (perhaps a reference to Medusa's deadly power) and the various symbols are illustrated with taste and refinement.
Our play is accompanied by the sound of drums that make us feel like we are at war, in short: NextGen Gaming's Medusa proves to be a pleasant slot to look at before actually trying the game. Let's see if the gameplay mechanics are on the same level.

How to play Medusa
What we have in front of us is a traditional slot, with five reels that spin on themselves and each displaying three symbols per play. The paylines are twenty-five, a value that falls within the average of online slots and the RTP only slightly exceeds 95%.
The aspect that strikes most about this title is the presence of numerous special symbols. We obviously start with the same Medusa: the enchanting face of the woman is a Wild symbol capable of replacing all the other normal symbols in the game. It appears only in the three central reels.
The title of the slot, MEDUSA, and the winged horse Pegasus are two Scatter symbols that allow access to the bonus modes and the Soldier allows access to the "Super Spin" feature.
A slot, therefore, to be tried out, which demonstrates as much care in graphic details as in gameplay mechanics.

Slots similar to Medusa
As we established at the beginning of this review, the pantheon of slots themed "Ancient Greece" is very crowded, so it's not possible to list them all. But if we were looking for some similar titles, we could think of 300 Shields (and its variants) always from NextGen Gaming, as well as Age of Gods from Playtech. Or even Aura of Zeus from Bally Wulff, a company that also proposes Disc of Athena.

response.headline: Gameplay features
response.content: Medusa follows the traditional slot gameplay structure with five reels and twenty-five paylines. The RTP slightly exceeds 95%. The special symbols include a Wild symbol, which is the face of Medusa and appears only in the three central reels. Two Scatter symbols, MEDUSA, and Pegasus, allow access to the bonus modes, and the Soldier allows access to the "Super Spin" feature.

response.headline: Graphics and design
response.content: NextGen Gaming's Medusa is a visually stunning online slot game. The game grid rotates above what appears to be stone, perhaps a reference to Medusa's deadly power. The background shows a Hellenic world with temples and helmets. The various symbols are illustrated with taste and refinement, making the game a pleasure to look at. The sound of drums that accompanies the game adds to Medusa's immersive gameplay experience.

Review: Medusa
There's no denying it: ancient history, with its myths and legends, will always have a prominent place in our imagination and in our works. We're talking about movies, books, video games, and more: there are more and more titles that exploit the ancient Egyptian, Roman, and Greek populations as themes.
And the world of online slots is no different, we can count hundreds of slots inspired by ancient Egypt and Greece (the Roman Empire is still relatively untapped in comparison) and today's title is precisely inspired by one of the many Greek legends: the myth of Medusa.
NextGen Gaming takes us back in time and on a fantasy trip, to discover one of the most famous women of all time: with snakes in place of her hair and the power to petrify with her gaze, Medusa is known all over the world.
Let's discover her again with this slot.

The visual aspect of Medusa
Let's start our analysis with the most direct aspect that will strike us: the graphics. Many development studios decide to concentrate their energies exclusively on the game mechanics, knowing the importance that this factor represents.
But we will never stop saying that the eye also wants its part and that a slot with aesthetic taste is easier to be tried by new players.
Medusa certainly falls into this category: the frame of the game grid only hints at the Hellenic world, with temples and helmets in the background. The game grid rotates above what appears to be stone (perhaps a reference to Medusa's deadly power) and the various symbols are illustrated with taste and refinement.
Our play is accompanied by the sound of drums that make us feel like we are at war, in short: NextGen Gaming's Medusa proves to be a pleasant slot to look at before actually trying the game. Let's see if the gameplay mechanics are on the same level.

How to play Medusa
What we have in front of us is a traditional slot, with five reels that spin on themselves and each displaying three symbols per play. The paylines are twenty-five, a value that falls within the average of online slots and the RTP only slightly exceeds 95%.
The aspect that strikes most about this title is the presence of numerous special symbols. We obviously start with the same Medusa: the enchanting face of the woman is a Wild symbol capable of replacing all the other normal symbols in the game. It appears only in the three central reels.
The title of the slot, MEDUSA, and the winged horse Pegasus are two Scatter symbols that allow access to the bonus modes and the Soldier allows access to the "Super Spin" feature.
A slot, therefore, to be tried out, which demonstrates as much care in graphic details as in gameplay mechanics.

Slots similar to Medusa
As we established at the beginning of this review, the pantheon of slots themed "Ancient Greece" is very crowded, so it's not possible to list them all. But if we were looking for some similar titles, we could think of 300 Shields (and its variants) always from NextGen Gaming, as well as Age of Gods from Playtech. Or even Aura of Zeus from Bally Wulff, a company that also proposes Disc of Athena.

response.headline: Graphics That Will Make You Want to Turn to Stone
response.content:
Get ready to feast your eyes on NextGen Gaming's stunning online slot game, Medusa. The game's grid spins above a stone-like platform, which is a nod to the mythological creature's lethal power. As you play, you'll be transported to a Hellenic world, complete with temples and helmets. But the real showstopper are the beautifully crafted symbols. Each one exudes sophistication and refinement, making the game a visual feast.

And it's not just about the looks either - the sound of drums that accompanies the game will have you feeling completely immersed. So buckle up and get ready for Medusa to turn your world (and your bank account) upside down!

response.headline: Special Symbols
response.content:
Get ready for some serious snake action, folks, because Medusa has a whole bunch of special symbols that will leave you hissing with excitement. First up, we've got the Wild symbol, which can replace any other symbol in the game except for the Scatters. And speaking of Scatters, there are two to watch out for: the iconic Medusa and her trusty steed, Pegasus. Land three of these bad boys and you'll trigger the bonus modes faster than you can say 'I need a hero.'

Finally, let's not forget about the Soldier symbol, which unlocks the epic 'Super Spin' feature. Get your battle gear on, because this is where the real money lies. The Scatter symbols may be sweet, but the Super Spin is like a box of chocolates: you never know what you're gonna get, but it's usually pretty dang good.

All in all, these special symbols are what make Medusa one of the most exciting slots on the market. Don't believe us? Give it a spin and see for yourself.

Medusa slot game overview

Medusa is a slot game developed by NextGen Gaming and inspired by the Greek legend of Medusa. The game features a traditional slot layout with five reels and twenty-five paylines, and an RTP of just over 95%. It stands out for its numerous special symbols, including a Wild symbol that can replace all others, two Scatter symbols that activate bonus modes, and a Soldier symbol that triggers the Super Spin feature.

Gameplay and features

Medusa's gameplay follows the classic slot mechanics. Players spin the reels, hoping to land winning combinations on the paylines. The Wild symbol, represented by Medusa's face, can substitute for all regular symbols in the game and appears only on the three central reels. The Scatter symbols, MEDUSA and Pegasus, trigger different bonus modes. Finally, the Soldier symbol activates the Super Spin feature, which gives players a chance to win higher payouts. Overall, the game combines traditional slot gameplay with engaging special features.

Graphics and design

Medusa has a well-designed aesthetic, with the game grid located on a stone-like background, perhaps a reference to Medusa's petrifying power. The symbol design is thoughtful and elegant, and the game's accompanying sound effects add to its immersive atmosphere. The game's general theme, inspired by ancient Greek mythology, is subtle but clear and makes this slot visually appealing.

Special symbols

Medusa's special symbols add to the excitement and give players more chances to win. Medusa's face, a Wild symbol, can replace all regular symbols. MEDUSA and Pegasus, the two Scatter symbols, activate bonus modes that can lead to bigger payouts. Finally, the Soldier symbol unlocks the Super Spin feature, which increases players' chances of winning even more. Overall, Medusa offers a variety of special symbols that make the game more engaging and rewarding.

Other Ancient Greece-inspired online slots

Ancient Greek mythology is a popular theme among online slot games, and there are many titles similar to Medusa. NextGen Gaming also developed 300 Shields and its variants. Playtech offers the Age of Gods series, while Bally Wulff created Aura of Zeus and Disc of Athena. These slots have their unique features and designs, but they all share the common motif of ancient Greece and its mythology.

faq.answer: Medusa is an online slot game inspired by the Greek legend of Medusa, created by NextGen Gaming.

faq.answer: The special symbols in Medusa include the Wild Medusa symbol, Scatter symbols like MEDUSA and Pegasus, and a Soldier symbol that allows access to the 'Super Spin' feature.

faq.question: What is the gameplay like in Medusa?
faq.answer: Medusa is a traditional slot with five reels and three symbols per play. The game features numerous special symbols, including Wild and Scatter symbols. The gameplay is fun and engaging.

faq.answer: Other slots with a similar Ancient Greece theme include 300 Shields, Age of Gods, Aura of Zeus, and Disc of Athena.

faq.prompt:
Below is a review of the game "Medusa".

Please provide an FAQ:

- 8 questions
- Use simple language and provide practical takeaways.
- Respond with a JSON!
- Use the key "faq" and an array with the keys "question" and "answer". 

Review: Medusa
There's no denying it: ancient history, with its myths and legends, will always have a prominent place in our imagination and in our works. We're talking about movies, books, video games, and more: there are more and more titles that exploit the ancient Egyptian, Roman, and Greek populations as themes.
And the world of online slots is no different, we can count hundreds of slots inspired by ancient Egypt and Greece (the Roman Empire is still relatively untapped in comparison) and today's title is precisely inspired by one of the many Greek legends: the myth of Medusa.
NextGen Gaming takes us back in time and on a fantasy trip, to discover one of the most famous women of all time: with snakes in place of her hair and the power to petrify with her gaze, Medusa is known all over the world.
Let's discover her again with this slot.

The visual aspect of Medusa
Let's start our analysis with the most direct aspect that will strike us: the graphics. Many development studios decide to concentrate their energies exclusively on the game mechanics, knowing the importance that this factor represents.
But we will never stop saying that the eye also wants its part and that a slot with aesthetic taste is easier to be tried by new players.
Medusa certainly falls into this category: the frame of the game grid only hints at the Hellenic world, with temples and helmets in the background. The game grid rotates above what appears to be stone (perhaps a reference to Medusa's deadly power) and the various symbols are illustrated with taste and refinement.
Our play is accompanied by the sound of drums that make us feel like we are at war, in short: NextGen Gaming's Medusa proves to be a pleasant slot to look at before actually trying the game. Let's see if the gameplay mechanics are on the same level.

How to play Medusa
What we have in front of us is a traditional slot, with five reels that spin on themselves and each displaying three symbols per play. The paylines are twenty-five, a value that falls within the average of online slots and the RTP only slightly exceeds 95%.
The aspect that strikes most about this title is the presence of numerous special symbols. We obviously start with the same Medusa: the enchanting face of the woman is a Wild symbol capable of replacing all the other normal symbols in the game. It appears only in the three central reels.
The title of the slot, MEDUSA, and the winged horse Pegasus are two Scatter symbols that allow access to the bonus modes and the Soldier allows access to the "Super Spin" feature.
A slot, therefore, to be tried out, which demonstrates as much care in graphic details as in gameplay mechanics.

Slots similar to Medusa
As we established at the beginning of this review, the pantheon of slots themed "Ancient Greece" is very crowded, so it's not possible to list them all. But if we were looking for some similar titles, we could think of 300 Shields (and its variants) always from NextGen Gaming, as well as Age of Gods from Playtech. Or even Aura of Zeus from Bally Wulff, a company that also proposes Disc of Athena.
